article_text:
Not-so-bad economy beats the alternative Paul Krugman says U.S. economic performance has done relatively well of late only if you grade on a curve.

According to the economist Kevin O'Rourke, who has been doing a comparison between the Great Depression that began in 1929 and the Great Recession that began almost eight years ago, the world has just passed a sad landmark. While the initial slump this time around wasn't nearly as bad as the collapse from 1929 to 1933, the recovery has been weaker - and at this point world industrial production is doing worse than it did at the same point in the 1930s. A remarkable achievement!

article_metadata.description: According to the economist Kevin O'Rourke, who has been doing a comparison between the Great Depression that began in 1929 and the Great Recession that began almost eight years ago, the world has just passed a sad landmark.  [...] unemployment has been cut in half, and the Federal Reserve is getting ready to raise interest rates at a time when its counterpart, the European Central Bank, is still seeking ways to boost spending.  In his recent book "The Courage to Act," Ben Bernanke, the former Fed chairman, celebrates his institution's willingness to step in and rescue the financial system, which was indeed the right thing to do.  [...] the Fed stuck to its, um, printing presses, arguing that the rise in inflation was a one-time blip driven mainly by oil prices - and it was proved right.  [...] on the other side of the Atlantic, the European Central Bank gave in to inflation panic, raising interest rates twice in 2011 - and in so doing helped push the euro area into a double-dip recession.  [...] it was much better than nothing, and was enacted over opposition from Republicans claiming that it would cause soaring interest rates and a fiscal crisis.  Unfortunately, the U.S. ended up doing a fair bit of austerity too, partly driven by conservative state governments, partly imposed by Republicans in Congress via blackmail over the federal debt ceiling.
article_metadata.author.name: By Paul Krugman
